channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: A-levels in Wales: Grades set to be above pre-Covid levels
item.description: Teachers say they want this year's results to be celebrated after the "shambles" of last year's grading.

item.title: A-level results day in Wales: Your questions answered
item.description: It is earlier than usual this year and most students already know their grades.

item.title: Rhyl cancer patient suffered from 'alarming failings' at Glan Clwyd Hospital
item.description: Ann Jones, 69, died after "alarming failings" at Wales' largest health board, says ombudsman.

item.title: Climate change: IPCC report heralds Wales' 'last-chance saloon'
item.description: Rising sea levels could force the "significant relocation of communities" in Wales, one expert warns.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Gary Jenkins dies 16 days after incident
item.description: Father-of-two Dr Gary Jenkins had been in hospital since the attack in a Cardiff Park on 20 July.

item.title: Gang tried to kidnap Anglesey child over satanic abuse fear
item.description: Two gang members snatched the child at knifepoint as they returned home from school.

item.title: Cardiff man's plea after Covid claims three family members
item.description: Francis Goncalves lost his brother, father and mother to the virus within a week of each other.

item.title: Wrexham father in intensive care after refusing Covid vaccine
item.description: Father-of-two Artur Brylowski is in intensive care with Covid having turned down a vaccine.

item.title: Towyn: Teen sister of murder accused 'died of asphyxia'
item.description: Amanda Selby, 15, whose brother has been charged with her murder, died of asphyxia, inquest hears.

item.title: Major fraud probe into entrepreneur Gavin Woodhouse
item.description: The Serious Fraud Office said it is investigating "suspected fraud and money laundering".

item.title: Hell's Mouth: Man dies after getting into difficulty in the sea
item.description: The man died at the scene after being pulled from the sea off the north Wales coast on Friday.

item.title: Cardiff: Man charged with raping stranger 41 years ago
item.description: The 66-year-old was arrested following a review of an unsolved attack in Cardiff in 1980.

item.title: Wrexham man left fighting for life after refusing Covid jab
item.description: Gym-goer Artur Brylowski refused a vaccine and is now in intensive care with Covid.

item.title: Pollution: 'This is my coffin, this is why I swim with it'
item.description: Wild swimmer Angela Jones says she hopes her specially designed coffin will catch attention.

item.title: Covid: Excitement as nightclubs reopen in Wales
item.description: Most of Wales' remaining Covid rules are lifted as nightclubs reopen in alert level zero.

item.title: Covid: How will we adjust to life without so many rules?
item.description: With Wales moving into alert level zero, an expert says behaviours learnt in the pandemic might last.

item.title: Covid: Hospitality rules change after '18 months of hell'
item.description: Two-metre distancing and masks will not be legally required in pubs and restaurants from Saturday.

item.title: Covid: Live music in Wales resumes with Feeder gig
item.description: Despite outdoor restrictions being relaxed weeks ago, the venue is still taking precautions.

item.title: Rabbi Matondo: Cercle Brugge sign Wales winger on loan from FC Schalke 04
item.description: Belgian Pro League side Cercle Brugge have agreed a deal to sign Wales winger Rabbi Matondo from Germany's FC Schalke 04 on a season long loan.

item.title: The Hundred: Imran Tahir takes first hat-trick as Phoenix batter Fire
item.description: Imran Tahir and Will Smeed combine to devastating effect as Birmingham Phoenix climb to the top of the men's Hundred table with victory over Welsh Fire.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Price targets more Olympic success after boxing gold
item.description: Olympic boxing champion Lauren Price is likely to go for gold again in Paris rather than turn professional.

item.title: British and Irish Lions: How will the South Africa tour be remembered and what next for the Lions?
item.description: After a Lions series full of rancour and underwhelming rugby, how will the tour be remembered and where do the team go from here?

item.title: Shafali Verma keeps Phoenix's Hundred hopes alive with Fire win
item.description: India's teenage superstar Shafali Verma crunches a rapid half-century as Birmingham Phoenix keep their slim hopes alive with an empathic victory over Welsh Fire in the women's Hundred.

item.title: Dathlu llwyddiant myfyrwyr ar ôl 'llanast' llynedd
item.description: Mae angen dathlu graddau Safon Uwch eleni ar ôl "arswyd yr algorithm" y llynedd, yn ôl arweinwyr addysg.

item.title: Beth ydy'r drefn canlyniadau arholiad eleni?
item.description: Wedi trafferthion mawr ar ddiwrnod cyhoeddi canlyniadau Safon Uwch y llynedd, bydd pethau'n wahanol eleni.

item.title: Nofwyr y gogledd 'dan anfantais' heb bwll 50m Olympaidd
item.description: Mae nofwyr ifanc o'r gogledd yn gorfod teithio i Loegr neu dde Cymru i hyfforddi mewn pwll 50m.

item.title: Lle fyddai Cymru yn nhabl medalau Tokyo 2020?
item.description: Enillodd aelodau Cymreig Tîm GB wyth o fedalau yn y Gemau Olympaidd eleni.

item.title: Seiclwr o Abertawe yn 'un i'w gwylio' yn y dyfodol
item.description: Dywed Eluned King ei bod wedi elwa o'r cyfnod clo a'i bod yn gobeithio seiclo yng Ngemau'r Gymanwlad yn 2022.
